senses.de: A magazine or newspaper published at regular intervals.
senses.ex: I subscribe to several periodicals that focus on business and economics.

Tips.title: Subscription Common
Tips.description: People often subscribe to periodicals to receive them regularly without buying each time.
Tips.example: I got a subscription to a gardening periodical.

Tips.title: Specialized Topics
Tips.description: Many periodicals are focused on specific topics; choose one that matches your interests.
Tips.example: She reads a medical periodical to stay updated on healthcare trends.

Tips.title: Issue Frequency
Tips.description: Understand whether the periodical is daily, weekly, monthly or quarterly to manage expectations.
Tips.example: His favorite periodical is issued on a weekly basis.

senses.de: Occurring or appearing at regular intervals.
senses.ex: The sunflowers make a periodical appearance in our garden every summer.

Tips.title: Time Management
Tips.description: Periodical events help in planning and anticipation, as they occur at known intervals.
Tips.example: The team holds periodical reviews every quarter.

Tips.title: Predictability
Tips.description: Periodical means you can expect the event to happen again, providing a sense of regularity.
Tips.example: The garden club has periodical plant sales.

Tips.title: Reliable Scheduling
Tips.description: Consistent periodical activities can offer stability in schedules, like maintenance checks.

Bulletin.wordDefinition:
A bulletin is a brief and concise announcement or report that is published periodically, usually weekly, monthly or quarterly, and it provides information about specific events, news or updates on a particular topic.

A bulletin is often used to share the latest information with a specific audience, such as members of an organization or employees in a company.

A bulletin is a brief, targeted and periodic report about a specific topic, while a periodical is a more comprehensive, regular publication that covers a wider range of topics.

Digest.wordDefinition:
A digest is a condensed version or summary of information or content, while a periodical is a publication that is issued regularly, such as a magazine or newspaper.

A digest is applicable when someone wants to quickly review a large amount of information or data in a shorter time. For example, a businessperson who needs to read through a long report but has limited time may use a digest of that report to quickly familiarize themselves with the main points.

Gazette.wordDefinition:
A gazette is a type of newspaper that is typically published by a government or organization. It contains official notices, announcements, and information related to the activities of the government or organization.

To simplify it, a gazette is a special type of newspaper that is published by a government or organization, while a periodical is any type of publication that is released at regular intervals and covers a range of topics.

Journal.wordDefinition:
A journal is a type of publication that typically focuses on a specific academic or professional field or topic. It contains articles written by experts and researchers in that field and is published on a regular basis.

Journals are usually considered to be more scholarly and specialized than magazines, and they often undergo a peer-review process before being published.

A journal is a specialized publication that focuses on a specific field or topic, while a periodical is a more general publication that covers a variety of topics for a general audience.

Magazine.wordDefinition:
A magazine is a publication that is issued periodically, usually on a monthly basis. It typically contains articles and other features on a specific topic or topics of interest, such as fashion, sports, or technology.

Magazines may also include advertisements and photographs.

A periodical refers to any publication that is issued at regular intervals, including both magazines and newspapers. This term is more general and can be applied to any publication that is published regularly.

So, magazines are a specific type of periodical that are typically more focused on a particular topic or set of topics, while periodicals can refer to any regular publication, including magazines, newspapers, and other types of publications.

Newsletter.wordDefinition:
A newsletter is a type of publication that is usually distributed regularly by an organization or group to its members or subscribers.

A newsletter is a type of periodical that is specific to a particular group, while a periodical can refer to any publication that is issued at regular intervals.

Newspaper.wordDefinition:
Newspaper refers to a printed publication that is usually published every day or week, which mainly contains news and current events.

A newspaper focuses on reporting and sharing news and current events, while a periodical focuses on providing useful and informative content on a specific topic or area of interest.

Publication.wordDefinition:
A periodical refers to a publication that is released on a regular schedule, such as weekly, monthly, or quarterly. Examples include newspapers, magazines, and journals.

A publication refers to any printed or digital material that is made available to the public. This can include books, newspapers, magazines, reports, and online articles.

A periodical is a type of publication that is released regularly, while publication is a more general term that encompasses any printed or digital material available to the public.

Review.wordDefinition:
A review is a critical evaluation of something, such as a book, movie, or product. This evaluation will often include a summary of the work and an analysis of its strengths and weaknesses.

Both periodicals and reviews can be found in a variety of formats, including print and online. Periodicals are often used for staying up-to-date on current events or industry news, while reviews can be helpful in deciding whether or not to invest time or money in a particular product or work.

quotes.Text: I basically have needed to go to the piano and give voice periodically to, you know - I'm always afraid to describe it as a kind of therapeutic process, but nevertheless it was a type of unloading that had to occur due to my personal life with my mother's health or just my professional trials and tribulations.
quotes.Title: Canadian Musician
quotes.Name: Rufus Wainwright

quotes.Text: I talk periodically with the producers at EA and I try to be as honest as possible because as great as EA does, you just don't want to hear good things. These people are really passionate about making games and making them as realistic as possible.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Landon Donovan

quotes.Text: So without getting into the specifics, I can tell you that to the extent that investigation is a relatively important investigation and meaningful, the president would have been periodically briefed.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Robert Mueller

quotes.Text: I've fallen back on this periodically, although I must say that getting out of the grocery business ranked right up there with getting out of the army as one of the happier experiences of my life.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: David Eddings

quotes.Text: Periodically, at the end of a conversation, someone will ask me, 'Is there something I can do for you?' I used to answer with 'Do something that is helpful to something or someone in my world.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Brad Feld

quotes.Text: I take breaks from social media periodically because I think it is healthy to walk away and focus on the life that's in front of you instead of the life happening on your screen.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Ariel Winter

quotes.Text: If we glance at the most important revolutions in history, we see at once that the greatest number of these originated in the periodical revolutions on the human mind.
quotes.Title: Russian Philosopher
quotes.Name: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quotes.Text: Technology, ideology, and social and cultural changes periodically throw out new forms of violence for humanity to contend with.
quotes.Title: Canadian Scientist
quotes.Name: Steven Pinker

quotes.Text: It's important for a leader to hear about his blind spots on a regular basis so working on them is periodically top of mind.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Scott Weiss

quotes.Text: I've always believed that it's important to show a new look periodically. Predictability can lead to failure.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: T. Boone Pickens
